quotes.quote: Women are cursed, and men are the proof.
The curse of imagination is picturing the world as it should be.
It is the curse of prosperity that it takes work away from us, and shuts that door to hope and health of spirit.
It is the curse of the powerful to be blind to their own faults.
It is the curse of humanity that it learns to tolerate even the most horrible situations by habituation.
The curse of poverty has no justification in our age.
Some of us cling to our curses if we haven't anything better to cling to!
Curses are like processions. They return to the place from which they came.
Cursed is everyone who places his hope in changing the nature of man.
Poverty makes you wise but it's a curse.
Never curse a fall. The ground is where humility lives.
It is a curse, being blessed with so much to offer.
This is the curse of our age, even the strangest aberrations are no cure for boredom.
Unrequited love is the infinite curse of a lonely heart.
In our time, the curse is monetary illiteracy, just as inability to read plain print was the curse of earlier centuries.
A great curse has fallen upon modern life with the discovery of the vastness of the word Education.
The great curse of modern political life is incrementalism.
Curses are like young chickens, they always come home to roost.
Emotions are the curse of logic.
The curse of modern times is, that almost everything does create controversy.
Every blessing ignored becomes a curse.
The curse is an incredible set of blue balls.
The curse of ignorance is that man without being good or evil is nevertheless satisfied with himself.
Beauty was a curse to be borne, not a blessing.
Light a candle instead of cursing the darkness.
Selfishness is the greatest curse of the human race.
We shall dig our own grave if we do not purge ourselves of this curse of untouchability.
Cursed is the man who ceaselessly loves without fear - He will inevitably fall in love with the devil.
All things will be ambiguous, for this is the curse of wisdom.
The curse of the sun and the moon is fake. It doesn`t exist.
Alimony is the curse of the writing class.
Love is, after all, a curse of suffering.
A curse lies upon those that, when the truth suffers, have not a word to defend it.
The curse of an interesting life: there are either very good times or very bad times.
Commitment is a curse if it interferes with righteousness.
The greatest curse that can befall a free people, is civil war.
The curse of the romantic is a greed for dreams, an intensity of expectation that, in the end, diminishes the reality.
The curse of fatherhood is distance, and the good fathers spend their lives trying to overcome it.
The curse of covetousness is that it destroys manhood by substituting money for character.
